title: Sequoia Grove 2013 Cambium Red (Napa Valley)
description: Already aged in bottle for some time, this Bordeaux can withstand plenty more evolution in bottle, its bright red fruit structured enough within a tight frame of chalky tannin and coconut oak. The ripeness is moderate and in balance.

title: Serge Dagueneau et Filles 2016 Clos des Chaudoux  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: Harvested from a small parcel, less than four acres, this wine is in perfect condition. It is balanced, with white fruit and citrus coming together, led by the acidity. It is developing into a full, ripe wine. Wait until 2019.

title: Siduri 2016 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Quite subtle at first on the nose, this bottling offers baked red-cherry aromas and a dusting of soil with some swirling. The palate blends dark red cherry with touches of sagebrush and wild thyme, lifted by a hint of white pepper.

title: Stolpman 2016 Estate Grown Syrah (Ballard Canyon)
description: Compact elderberry aromas and purple flowers mesh with savory touches of roasted beef and black pepper on the nose of this bottling, which is quite young. Black-currant and lilac flavors pop on the sip before the tightly woven structure temporarily hides them, though they will surely arise in the years to come. Drink 2020–2036.

title: Teso La Monja 2015 Almirez  (Toro)
description: A graphite note and the essence of fine oak sit nicely atop a nose defined by blackberry, prune and raisin aromas. A tight palate qualifies as direct, while this Toro cruiserweight tastes of toasty oaky black fruits and pepper. A spicy dry finish doesn't waver, and this Tinta de Toro will age well; drink through 2027.

title: Thomas Schmitt 2017 Estate Bottled Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)
description: The nose of this wine is quite elegant, offering notes of wet slate, honey and lemon. Off-dry in style, it seems to build in fruitiness on the palate, moving from zesty lime and lemon to sweet white grapefruit and peach. Enjoy now–2025.

title: Toil Oregon 2017 Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)
description: A lovely reddish copper shade, this is a rich and complex wine, fermented in neutral barrels and briefly aged in stainless steel. Scents and flavors suggest dried straw, mild earth, wild strawberries and a splash of guava juice. It's far more interesting than most rosés, while retaining all the simple pleasure and freshness that makes these wines so popular.

title: Torres 2015 Cos Perpetual Red (Priorat)
description: Spicy black-fruit aromas are potent, with side notes of clove, lemon peel and charred wood. This is lush, clean and modern in style. Fully ripe blackberry and cassis flavors come with an underlay of chocolaty oak. On a smooth finish, tobacco flavors stand out. Drink through 2023.

title: Weinreich 2013 Bechtheimer Trocken Schwartzriesling (Rheinhessen)
description: Schwartzriesling is better known as Pinot Meunier, the unsung supporting player in many classic Champagne blends. This varietal still wine is a gorgeously transparent expression of Schwartzriesling redolent of pristine blackberries and raspberries. It's primary and quaffable yet nuanced by earthen hints of beetroot and bramble. Concentrated yet crisp, it finishes with a fringe of silky tannins.

title: Loimer NV Brut Rosé Reserve Sparkling (Österreichischer Sekt)
description: The aromatic mellowness of very ripe, red apples mingles with notes of fresh short crust pastry on the nose. The bubbles are tiny and soft, fizzing away while a sublime streak of freshness gives precision and purity on this creamy, classy and very elegant pink sparkler.

title: Aberrant Cellars 2016 Chehalem Mountain Vineyard Block B3 Old Vines Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: Sourced from a vineyard planted in 1968 by Oregon pioneer Dick Erath, this complex and textural effort melds together brambly blackberry fruit with elements of spice, sassafras and mocha. The wine is nicely layered through the lingering finish. It should continue to drink well through 2025.
designation: Chehalem Mountain Vineyard Block B3 Old Vines

title: Aver Family Vineyards 2014 Faith Red (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Intensely dark in the glass, this impressive blend of 58% Petite Sirah, 39% Syrah and 3% Carignan shows strong aromas of black currant, black plum, whole peppercorn and violet. Sandy tannins frame the dry palate, which combines structural power with balanced depth, offering flavors of black currant and burned caramel that are buoyed by bright acidity.

title: Bethel Heights 2016 Aeolian Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: Named to acknowledge the windy corridor that gives this estate's fruit its grip and concentration, this is a fine entry into an outstanding portfolio. Complex and supple, it's loaded with fruit flavors of blueberry, plum and cherry. Oak aging has added nuanced notes of cinnamon and cedar.

title: Biondi 2016 Pianta Bianco  (Etna)
description: Made with 90% Carricante and 10% Catarratto. Aromas of Spanish broom, yellow apple, candied citrus zest and a whiff of Mediterranean herb follow through to the fresh, elegant palate along with a note of honeyed nut and a hint of exotic spice. An almost salty mineral note lingers on the finish.

title: Cellers Baronia del Montsant 2011 Englora Red (Montsant)
description: Maple and mocha aromas are cedary and rich. An intense palate brings the power but also elegance. Flavors of oaky vanilla and lemon peel accent baked fruit and sweet maple notes. On the finish, coffee and cocoa join latent berry flavors in a slow fade. Drink through 2023.

title: Chiron Wines 2015 Candor Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Densely concentrated and rich in red fruit, this 100% varietal wine also offers complex layers of tobacco, earth and dried herb, mingling it all together into a cohesive whole. The tannins are plush and polished, giving the wine strength with purpose.

title: Collet 2008 Brut Millésime  (Champagne)
description: From one of the many fine Champagne vintages this century, this intense wine is structured and still young. There is some richness from the ripe Pinot Noir in the blend but ultimately this tight wine would benefit from further aging. Drink from 2020.

title: Delamotte NV Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: Based in Le Mesnil-sur-Oger in the heart of the Côte des Blancs, this producer knows a thing or two about Chardonnay Champagnes. The proof is in this intense, mineral and citrus-driven wine. It has depth of flavor giving concentration as well as richness. Drink this bottling from 2019.

title: Domaine Divio 2016 Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: Each of the winery's Pinots showcases a specific AVA, and each is quite distinctive. Here, the sharply etched scents suggest raspberry jam and preserved lemon, and the following flavors retain that tight focus. Notes of blood orange and pineapple highlight the acidity, and the wine continues on with herbal notes. The tannins, still a bit stiff, will benefit from further bottle aging.

title: Domaine Fouassier 2016 Le Clos de Bannon  (Sancerre)
description: This producer, now in its 10th generation, sources the grapes for this wine from a seven-acre vineyard on clay and chalk soils. Made from biodynamically grown grapes, this rich wine is full of generous apple and apricot flavors that are now mature enough to drink. The wine could also age, so drink now or until 2022.
